intro: Pelexia longepetiolata, commonly known as the long-petioled pelexia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, elongated petioles that support its palmately lobed leaves. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Pelexia longepetiolata is often found in moist, shaded habitats like woodlands and along stream banks.
